documentation.abstract: Ask for a brand new block Block, representing an ImmutableBlock
documentation.description: For now, this can only create CHBs (Content Hash Blocks), a content-addressed type of Block whose address is computed by applying an hashing function to their content and owner address. The resulting Block is forged according to the given MakeImmutableBlockRequest (N.B. The Block is not pushed yet on the key-value store)

documentation.abstract: Ask for a brand new Block, representing a MutableBlock
documentation.description: Create a special type of MutableBlock, named OKB (Owner Key Block). OKBs data are encrypted by a private key, named owner. Only people having access to this key can read, modify or delete an OKB. The address is chosen randomly by the key-value store. Hence, the MakeMutableBlockRequest has no attributes. The resulting Block is forged according to the given MakeMutableBlockRequest (N.B. The Block is not pushed yet on the key-value store)

documentation.abstract: Ask for a brand new Block, representing a NamedBlock
documentation.description: NamedBlock are special ImmutableBlocks whose addresses are computable using both the public key of their owner (by default, the key-value store's public key) and their name name. The data can be assigned to the block, before insertion, using setter of data_plain (set_data_plain). The resulting Block is forged according to the given MakeNamedBlockRequest (N.B. The Block is not pushed yet on the key-value store)

documentation.abstract: Ask for a translation between a name and an Address
documentation.description: The NamedBlocks are blocks whose address can be calculated by applying an one way function (e.g. sha256) to a tuple (owner, name)

documentation.abstract: Fetch the block at given address
Insert a new Block
documentation.description: The Block to insert is given by the InsertRequest. The Block should have been created by using Make<...>Block. Insert returns an InsertResponse, containing the information related to the Insertion

documentation.abstract: Update an existing block
documentation.description: The address and the new content of the Block are given by the UpdateRequest. Update doesn't perform an upsert, hence, the update will fail if the block doesn't exist, but also you are not allowed to update it. The UpdateResponse will contain the information related to the result of the insertion attempt

documentation.abstract: Erase the block at the given address
documentation.description: The address of the Block is given by the RemoveRequest. The ability to remove a Block is determined by two factors: The existence of the Block and the permission to delete it. The RemoveResponse will contain the information related to result of the deletion attempt
